content.description: Climb the thin seam from a good start hold. Hang on tightly through the low crux. It is fun climbing to the chains.
content.location:
This is the first route right

Crack Seam

, just to the left of the big crack where the wall pushes out.

content.description: This is a great route despite some suspect rock toward the start. The crux is up high with a very thoughtful sequence.
content.location:
Start in a corner just to the left of "

A Squirrel, a Mole, and a Chicken

."

content.description: Fun, balanced slab moves lead to fun steps and pulls on positive holds.
content.location:
This is to the left of "

Meatballs

." The plaque at base might be stolen.

climbs.name: Pinkies Up
climbs.fa: Nathan Ross/ Eamon Swihart/ Van Norton

content.description: This is a short, hard, sustained yet fun route. Only holds on the Wall are the holds you need. There may or may not be pinky undercling rest. It is very fun!
content.location:
It is directly right of “

Cosmos Crack Garden

.”

content.description:
This challenging little route has a fun challenging boulder problem. It felt more like V4 / low 5.12 to me, but maybe I missed something. Expect old school bolting and to be pulling the crux a bit above the second bolt.

Climb relatively easy ground to the first bolt, and enter a small, left-facing corner system for the second bolt. Make an easy clip, and set up for the crux. Some powerful and committing moves take you up to good holds and the 3rd bolt. Climb easier ground to the anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a set of anchors.
content.location: This is on a small section of wall with 2 routes. To the left is Check 1, a blank looking 12c. To the right up the hill and around the corner is Transplant & Lodgepole.

content.description: Get ready to fly like a meatball! Clip the first bolt, the courtesy bolt, and prepare for a battle to the anchor.  The crux comes after making a hard clip at the fourth bolt.  Master a sequence left of the fourth and fifth bolts to gain a marginal rest and hand traverse on positive holds.  If you're not flying high like a pastafarian yet, muster all your marinara and continue up, staying a little farther right of the upper corner than might be desirable.  A traverse back left from the corner and a few hard moves guard the anchor.  There is a high possibility for logging a little air time on this one.  It is best to lead it. Toproping it is a little problematic due to the overhanging and traversing nature of the route.  We figured it was on the upper end of 5.12, a challenging send no doubt.
content.protection: 8 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with quicklinks and cord (it might be a good idea to take a wrench and tighten loose hangers if you notice them, it seems like they take some time to 'settle in' on the limestone, and it seems like every route at the crag has at least one spinner).
content.location:
It is on Blank Check Wall, a few routes right of 'Transplant' and 2 routes left of '

A Squirrel, a Mole, and a Chicken

.'

content.description:
This climbs the right-facing corner to the left of a large tree, left of

Meatballs in Space

. It has good climbing that has cleaned up nicely with lots of jugs on steep rock.
content.location:
Lodgepols is left of a large pine tree to the left of

Meatballs

. Currently the route between

Meatballs

and

Transplant

.

climbs.name: Is it Nihilism or Nihilism? (Guess it Doesn't Matter)

content.description:
Start with hand jams under the roof and tiny feet, moving left up the crack while stemming feet. There are a couple bomber fists, and when the crack runs out in the middle, look to the right face. I recommend wearing crack gloves unless you lieback the whole thing.

After cleaning and putting in anchors, I originally did the FA on gear, but because this is a sports crag, I went ahead and bolted the line. It can be led with a single rack, 0.3-3.
content.location:
This ascends the obvious, overhanging, left-facing crack on the right side of the main

Blank Check

Wall between

Doobies at Dawn

and

When the Bottle Gets Empty

.

content.description: Start directly under the two jugs, or traverse in from the right fold up the bulge. Start into the crack, and find your feet. Make your way to the clipping jugs, then gain the right sidepull. Push/stem your way up to a good crimp and plenty of jugs to the anchors.
content.location:
This is the first route where the wall pushes out and the large crack. It is the next route after “

When The Bottle Gets Empty

.”

content.description: This ascends the finger crack to the right of the "Blank Check" project. Climb fun fingerlocks and sidepulls to a good rest, and surmount a small bulge to gain the anchors.
Start up the right facing crack for three bolts (crux) to easier climbing for three more bolts, then this route splits with two different finishes.
content.location: It is the furthest left route on this wall at this time.

climbs.name: Closed Project (Working name: There Will be Blood..and Cows)

content.description: The holds runout after bolt 2. It remains hard until the chains.
content.location:
This is directly right of the bolt to nowhere. It is the next line to the right of “

Pinkies Up

”.

content.description: This has good climbing that only gets harder to a crux just below the chains. It is great fun!
content.location:
It is the second route where the wall pushes out and the big crack. This is just to the right of “

Doobies At Dawn

”.

climbs.name: Blank Check
climbs.fa: Josh Wharton and Jed Wareham-Morris with help from Erinn and Hera Wharton

content.description:
Nasty tech weirdness up a seam feature leads to a big break. Continue with an easier but surprisingly difficult finale out the "5.10" bulge, which can be surmounted by looping left or right.

The movement is cool, and there is some nice rock, so if it was a little less sharp, a little longer, and didn't have the break, it would almost be a classic...almost. It did seem pretty hard though, which is always a redeeming feature, although it's probably 8a+ in 1984 Eldo grades.

Apparently this was a long abandoned Luke Laeser project. I'm unsure if anyone had actually tried it much over the years. The bottom seemed like it had been climbed on a bit, but the top was untraveled. Good training crag if you are planning a European tour of obscure, miniature1980s vertical limestone.

"Gold Hangers" and the "Slab Compressor," located 10 minutes downstream, look like they deserve more love.
content.protection: 6 bolts to fixed 'biners. I stickclipped the third bolt,and would not have added the first two had I bolted the route. Clipping the fourth bolt is tricky. Clipping the fifth bolt is easy but a bit spicy.
content.location:
This is the first route to the left of the 12a "

Crack Seam

."

climbs.name: A Squirrel, a Mole, and a Chicken
climbs.fa: Luke Laeser, Melissa Laeser, & David Schmidt, 2005

content.description:
This route is two routes right of '

Meatballs in Space

.'  It is a great warm up in conjunction with the neighboring mystery 11a to the left.
content.protection: Bolts and anchors with 'biners and links.
content.location:
It is on Blank Check Wall, 2 routes right of '

Meatballs in Space

.'
